title: Online Campaign Launch
previewText: CHU launches "A Helping Hand" campaign, which goes viral. The centerpiece is an emotional video depicting an elderly woman receiving a free boiler repair.
fullDescription: Community Helpers United (CHU) launches its flagship "A Helping Hand" campaign. The campaign quickly gains traction online, largely due to a highly emotional video that appears to show an elderly woman, visibly moved to tears, after receiving a brand new boiler, supposedly for free.

title: First Public Complaint & Harassment
previewText: A blogger posts an analysis suggesting an image used by CHU is a stock photo. In response, John Doe's social media accounts begin a targeted harassment campaign.
fullDescription: An independent blogger publishes a detailed analysis showing that a photograph used in a recent CHU fundraising appeal, allegedly of a family in need, is actually a widely available stock photo. The post gains some traction, questioning the authenticity of CHU's claims. Within hours, social media accounts linked to John Doe and his associates begin a coordinated campaign of online harassment against the blogger, including doxxing and threats.
